members.name: SDG 6.4.1 Water use efficiency USD/m3
members.description:
SDG Indicator 6.4.1 Water use efficiency in USD/m3. Annual values per country for the period 2009-2022, based on data stored in FAO Aquastat.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Agriculture, value added to GDP (current US$)
members.description:
Gross value added by agriculture (excluding river and marine fisheries and forestry), in current USD. Agriculture, forestry, and fishing corresponds to ISIC divisions 1-3 and includes forestry, hunting, and fishing, as well as cultivation of crops and livestock production. Value added is the net output of a sector after adding up all outputs and subtracting intermediate inputs. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or depletion and degradation of natural resources. The origin of value added is determined by the International Standard Industrial Classification (ISIC), revision 4.

 Source of data: World Bank, https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses#cc-by

members.name: Agricultural water withdrawal as % of total water withdrawal (%)
members.description:
Agricultural water withdrawal as percentage of total water withdrawal in %.

 Calculated as [Agricultural water withdrawal as % of total water withdrawal] = [Agricultural water withdrawal]/[Total water withdrawal]*100.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Industrial water withdrawal as % of total water withdrawal (%)
members.description:
Industrial water withdrawal as percentage of total water withdrawal in %.

 Calculated as [Industrial water withdrawal as % of total water withdrawal] = [Industrial water withdrawal]/[Total water withdrawal]*100.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Municipal water withdrawal as % of total withdrawal (%)
members.description:
Municipal water withdrawal as percentage of total water withdrawal in %.

 Calculated as [Municipal water withdrawal as % of total withdrawal] = [Municipal water withdrawal]/[Total water withdrawal]*100. 

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Municipal water withdrawal
members.description:
Annual quantity of water withdrawn primarily for the direct use by the population in 10^9 m3/year. It can include water from renewable freshwater resources, as well as water from over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal from fossil groundwater, direct use of agricultural drainage water, direct use of (treated) wastewater, and desalinated water. It is usually computed as the total water withdrawn by the public distribution network. It can include that part of the industries and urban agriculture, which is connected to the municipal network. The ratio between the net consumption and the water withdrawn can vary from 5 to 15% in urban areas and from 10 to 50% in rural areas.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Industrial water withdrawal
members.description:
Annual quantity of self-supplied water withdrawn for industrial uses in 10^9 m3/year. It can include water from renewable freshwater resources, as well as water from over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal from fossil groundwater, direct use of agricultural drainage water, direct use of (treated) wastewater, and desalinated water. This sector refers to self-supplied industries not connected to the public distribution network. The ratio between net consumption and withdrawal is estimated at less than 5%. It includes water for the cooling of thermoelectric and nuclear power plants, but it does not include hydropower. Water withdrawn by industries that are connected to the public supply network is generally included in municipal water withdrawal.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Agricultural water withdrawal
members.description:
Annual quantity of self-supplied water withdrawn for irrigation, livestock and aquaculture purposes in 10^9 m3/year. It can include water from renewable freshwater resources, as well as water from over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal from fossil groundwater, direct use of agricultural drainage water, direct use of (treated) wastewater, and desalinated water. Water for the dairy and meat industries and industrial processing of harvested agricultural products is included under industrial water withdrawal.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Water use efficiency of services sector
members.description:
Water use efficiency of the services sector in USD/m3.

 Calculated as [Gross value added by services sector/water withdrawal of the services sector.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Water use efficiency of industry
members.description:
Water use efficiency of industry in USD/m3.

 Calculated as [Gross value added by industry/water withdrawal of the industry sector.

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: Water use efficiency of agriculture
members.description:
Water use efficiency of agriculture in USD/m3.

 Calculated as [Water use efficiency of agriculture] = [Gross value added by agriculture]/[water withdrawal of the agricultural sector].

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en

members.name: % of agricultural GVA produced by irrigated agriculture
members.description:
Part of the gross value added by agriculture originating from the irrigated agriculture, as opposed to rainfed agriculture in %. In countries where rainfed agriculture dominates the agricultural sector, a large proportion of agricultural GVA in national accounts comes from values produced by rainfed agriculture. As the rainfed system does not entail direct water abstraction, the value added from this system needs to be deducted from the total agricultural GVA in order to obtain a realistic figure of WUE in agriculture.

 Calculated as [% of agricultural GVA produced by irrigated agriculture] = 1/(1+((1-([% of arable land irrigated]/100))/(([% of arable land irrigated]/100)*[Ratio between irrigated and rainfed yields]))).

 Source of data: Aquastat, https://www.fao.org/aquastat/statistics/query/index.html?lang=en
